data.title: Maria‐Luisa Duke Wed To F. A. de Peyster 3d
data.meta_description: NYC Civic Affairs Comr Angier Biddle Duke's daughter Maria-Luisa weds Frederic Ashton de Peyster 3d on Sept 10, Southampton, NY (S)
data.text:
Maria‐Luisa Biddle Duke, whose father, Angier Biddle Duke, is Commissioner of the New York City Department of Civic Affairs and Public Events, was married yesterday afternoon to Frederic Ashton de Peyster 3d, whose ancestor, Abraham de Peyster, was Mayor here from 1692 to 1694.

The Rev. Matthew Wisniewski performed the ceremony in the Roman Catholic Church of Our Lady of Po land in Southampton, L. I., where a reception was held at the home of Mrs. T. Markoe Robertson, the bride's grandmother.

Letitia Lynn was her stepsister's maid of honor. James A de Peyster Jr. was best man for his brother, whose parents are Mr. and Mrs. de Peyster of Palm Beach, Fla.

The bride is the daughter of the late Mrs Maria‐Luisa de Arena Duke, who died in a plane crash in 1961. Her engagement was announced last month by her father and stepmother, Mrs. Duke.

An alumna of the Foxcroft School, the bride is enrolled in the off‐campus program of Franconia College. Her husband, who has business interests on the West Coast, is an alumnus of Deerfield Academy and the University of Virginia. He has a master's degree in business and a law degree from Stanford University.

Mrs. de Peyster's father is a former Ambassador to El Salvador, Spain and Denmark and a former Chief of Protocol of the United States. He is descended on his mother's side from Nicholas Biddle, president of the Bank of the. United States early in the last century.

The bride's grandfather, the late Angier Buchanan Duke of Durham, N. C., was descended from Washington Duke, founder of the American Tobacco Company for whom Trinity College in Durham, now Duke University, changed its name. It was endowed by his sons.
